newsitem.title: JAPAN: WTO says talks with China on entry in final stage.
newsitem.headline: WTO says talks with China on entry in final stage.

text.p: The director-general of the World Trade Organisation (WTO), Renato Ruggiero, told a news conference on Friday that he thought negotiations with China on its entry into the world trade body were "approaching the final stages".
Ruggiero said all parties involved, including China, did not want to give any specific timeframe for its possible entry into the world trade body.
He said that the parties would continue to negotiate in the positive spirit they had shared in the last session which was a "very encouraging one".
However, he added: "It seems to me that we are approaching the final stages of negotiations."
The chief of the world trade body is in Tokyo for weeklong meetings with government officials and business leaders.
Concerning Taiwan's wish to join the WTO, he said its prospects were "encouraging" and much progress had been made.
However, he said there were still hurdles for Taiwan to overcome, but he did not say what they were.
Ruggiero said talks with China and Taiwan were separate issues.
On Russia's desire to join the body, he said: "There is strong will from everyone in the WTO to conclude negotiations as soon as possible."

In regard to the desire of many countries to have Russia as a member of the WTO and for the organisation to make the application process quicker for all candidates, he said: "We can be optimistic that 'as soon as possible' will mean something positive."
He reiterated his view that there will no changes in the relationship between Hong Kong and the WTO even after the British colony reverts to Chinese rule in the coming months.
Ruggiero said he based that view on the fact he had not received any comment from Hong Kong or China on that issue.
